c74object.name: the.jit.gl.imgseq
c74object.digest: Load and playback an image sequence
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2021, www.xenorama.com.
Load an image sequence by providing a single sample containing a numerical index pattern representing the entire sequence. Using bangs and frame commands the sequence can be played back losslessly in any direction or fashion. Especially useful for resampling during an offline rendering process. Requires the.imgseq.js. Apart from dedicated methods and attributes the.jit.gl.imgseq can be treated as a regular jit.gl.texture object.
c74object.discussion: the.jit.gl.imgseq is particularly designed to support lossless frame recall of a movie by supporting image sequences. However, the object itself does not load every single image of the seuence into memory for a fluid playback, it reads everyfile from disk into a single texture upon every frame instead. While this method is not suitable for realtime renderings it can be utilised when operating non-realtime capturing and resampling, ensuring lossless frame recall.

method.name: set
method.digest: Recall specific frame on next bang
method.description: Recall specific frame on next bang

method.name: getcount
method.digest: Output number of frames from dumpout
method.description: Output number of frames from rightmost dumpout, preceded by the word count

method.name: clear
method.digest: Clear all internal attributes and references
method.description: Clear all internal attributes and references. This will erase all data from the internal texture object, including the texture name. Any desired attributes will have to be applied anew.

attribute.name: load
attribute.description: Load an image sequence by providing a valid path to a single sample of the entire sequence

attribute.name: range
attribute.digest: Specify a frame range to cover
attribute.description: Specify a frame range to cover between 0 and maximum number of frames (-1).

attribute.name: direction
attribute.description:
Playback direction. Available options match those of the internal counter object.
0 = forward
1 = backward
2 = palindrome

attribute.name: pattrmode
attribute.digest: Expose sequence reference to any pattrstorage
attribute.description: Expose sequence reference to any pattrstorage (default: 1). Setting this flag to 0 will hide the sequence reference from pattrstorage and will not change/be recalled with presets.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description:
Output metadata and progress information. By default, this falg is disabled (0), if enabled, will output the following messages per frame from the rightmost dumpout:
frame (int) = current frame index
progress (0.-1.) = normalised position within range
position (0.-1.) = normalised position within entire sequence
